holidays.name: National Mutt Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate and promote the adoption of mixed-breed dogs, highlighting their unique charm and wonderful companionship.
holidays.origin: Started by pet lovers in 2005 to counterbalance purebred dog awareness days and encourage shelter adoptions.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that mutts often have fewer genetic health problems due to their diverse gene pool!

holidays.name: Put on Your Own Shoes Day
holidays.description: An unusual reminder to appreciate the simple act of putting on your own shoes and embracing independence!
holidays.origin: Origin uncertain, but celebrated to encourage self-reliance and gratitude for mobility.
holidays.funFact: This day playfully encourages people who usually get help with footwear to try doing it soloâ€”bonus points for wearing mismatched shoes!

holidays.name: Day of the Ninja
holidays.description: Celebrate the stealthy, mysterious warriors of Japan with costumes, ninja-themed activities, and appreciation of ninja culture.
holidays.origin: Invented in 2003 by the online community to honor ninjas, whose actual historical existence mixes fact and legend.
holidays.funFact: This day is unofficial but wildly popular among ninja fans worldwide, often featuring shadowy shurikens and sneaky fun!

holidays.name: National Fritters Day
holidays.description: Indulge in delicious deep-fried goodies like apple fritters, corn fritters, or whatever crispy treat you fancy!
holidays.origin: Food lovers established this day to appreciate fritter recipes and variations from around the globe.
holidays.funFact: The word 'fritter' comes from the Latin 'fricta,' meaning 'fried thing'â€”making it a perfect crispy celebration!
